events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th, providing basic details of the incident for initial claim processing.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a car collision and damages reported to the insured vehicle.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim and establish contact with the policyholder to guide the next steps.
Acknowledgement of claim receipt was sent to the customer confirming that the report of the car accident was successfully recorded.
The customer was requested to submit all relevant documents including photographs of the vehicle damage and the police report from the incident.
The insured party submitted the requested documents such as the accident photos, police report, and repair estimates for further processing.
An investigation was initiated to assess liability, verify damages, and evaluate the circumstances surrounding the reported auto accident.
The investigation into the vehicle collision was finalized, confirming the coverage scope and verifying the legitimacy of the claim.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant outlining the compensation amount based on the damage assessment and policy terms.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement proposal and acknowledged the clear communication throughout the claim process.
Formal approval of the claim was granted following the customer's acceptance of the settlement offer and completion of all documentation.
The approved payment amount was successfully issued to the customer's bank account as compensation for the verified car accident damages.
The claim file was formally closed after all processes were completed and the customer confirmed receipt of the insurance payout.
The auto accident claim documentation and records were archived in accordance with company policy for future reference and auditing.
